alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 02 at 3:08PM MST until September 02 at 6:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Coyote Wash in Coconino County in northern Arizona... * Until 615 PM MST. * At 307 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Coyote Wash. Between 0.25 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.75 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cottonwood Teepees Trailhead, White Pocket, Rainbow Valley Trailhead, The Wave, Stateline Campground, Paria River Slot Canyon and Vermilion Cliffs National Monument. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Paria River, House Rock Wash and Coyote Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.75 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
